page.title: 11Longworth Church (1)
page.content: In 1978 the parish of Longworth was legally joined with the neighbouring parishes of Hinton Waldrist,Charney Bassett,and Lyford,to form one new parish of Cherbury (the name is taken from the nearby site of Cherbury Camp, said to be the remains of an iron age fort).The parish has one rector who lives in Longworth,the largest of the villages.Canon Stuart has been preaching in Longworth church for 2 years. All the churches that he preaches in are over 700 years old and were built in the 13th century.The average number of people who attend Longworth church is about 45.The average age of people is about 50.He is the parish priest and his main jobs are taking services,baptising,marrying people,burying people,visiting the sick,preparing people for confirmation ,and pastoral welfare.
